forumNotes.author: wtarkan
forumNotes.content:
**Quemu Simple Boot v1.1 -- test your image files esily**  

**![Posted Image](http://imageshack.us/a/img821/6114/qsibv11.png)**  

**how to use it:**  
Download and unzip it then start Qsib.exe , Program interface is very simple just Drag and drop your .iso, .ima or .img files and click Start Qemu Test Button or select appropriate image file manually with + button (under Select CD/DVD Image File menu) ,Optionally you can change how much Ram it should use or you can choose to close the program after Qeumu started , in addition:  
- You can test your USB , CD/DVD images and discs  
- You can test your multiboot menu workout easily  
- You can add your own language (edit Qsib.ini) Turkish , English , German language are pre installed , program chooses appropriate language Automatically , it is portable and freeware  

**V.1.1 what is new**   
1. Latest QEMU version added  
2. Boot hangs -- Fixed  
3. Too long waiting time -- Fixed  
4. "Reset" and "Open the configuration" buttons added  
5. English readme file added (in info folder)  

[http://www.sordum.ne...ur-image-files/](http://www.sordum.net/quemu-simple-boot-v1-0-easily-test-your-image-files/ "External link")

forumNotes.author: Blackcrack
forumNotes.content:
work's well ! auto - German translation word well too ! Thank's !  
Suggestion :  
\[ \] Boot self/own disk -\> copy qsib and all the underfolders to :  
mkdir %temp%/qsip  
xcopy /y \*.\* %temp%/qsip/  
start %temp%/qsip/qsip.exe /sitches  

if clean goes down from the System so maby the configuration copy back from temp if send "stop" or "shut down"  

@shut down =xcopy /y %temp%/qsip/ %drive%/%drivefolder%/\*.\*  

or something ..  

so it is different other possible .. like i think..  
and "it is to big" imho today it is 40 MB normal : so want 10mb okey or something imho..  
best regards and happy programming ![:D](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/biggrin.png)  
Blacky

forumNotes.author: wtarkan
forumNotes.content:
It is easy to change Qemu version just add new Quemu files to the Quemu Folder then open qemuQsib.ini file   
and edit the \[Qemu_Options\]   

How big ? , Does the newer add more benefits ? For more infos please Click on the link below :  
[http://lassauge.free.fr/qemu/release/](http://lassauge.free.fr/qemu/release/ "External link")

Hi **@[wtarkan](http://reboot.pro/index.php?s=217b23ad31af26b4625474fd3f7726a7&showuser=60603 "Member profile")** , I didn't noticed this topic before. I assume it is you the developer (and thanks to bluelife for bringing it up to attention).  

Would you mind placing this tool on our downloads portal at <http://reboot.pro/files/> so that I can announce it over our newsletter next Monday? This also helps to bring more attention to the tool since many of our visitors just go straight to the downloads portal.  

I've promoted your account to advanced user so that you can upload the file there, if you need any help setting this up just let me know.  

Take care!
